prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: We propose to obtain ALMA imaging of 4 quasar jets. We wish to compare the morphology and broadband spectra of these jets to that seen in radio, optical and X-ray. Recent work by our team has revealed strong evidence against the previously dominant explanation for the X-ray emission in quasar jets, that of Comptonized CMB emission. We are exploring the alternative hypothesis that the X-ray emission is synchrotron radiation from a separate, high-energy electron population. Because of the observed spectral energy distribution shape, as well as differences between radio, optical and X-ray emission in these sources, the high-energy emission needs to come from a separate component than the particles that emit at GHz frequencies. This emission component should emerge at mm wavelengths. In addition, the mm band constitutes the location of the cooling break for the radio-emitting component.
